trans-unit.source: Contains properties and methods to provide consistent look and feel to all root designers on a workflow design surface.

> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] Typically, an instance of a sequential workflow root designer class is created when a workflow is created in a workflow designer and it represents the designer surface on which users can add and edit activities.
A workflow root designer does not have a parent designer unless it is the child of an <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.InvokeWorkflowActivity> activity.
All workflow root designers must derive from SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref> class.
Returns a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity"></xref> can be set as the parent of the activity associated with the designer.
Root designers cannot have a parent activity designer on a workflow design surface.
Unless overridden in an inheriting class, CanBeParentedTo returns `false`.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> to check.
to allow the activity associated with parentActivityDesigner to be the parent of the activity associated with the ; otherwise, .
Gets a value indicating whether the designer can be expanded and collapsed.
Unless overridden in a deriving class, CanExpandCollapse is always set to `false`.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref> can be expanded and collapsed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the footer associated with the root designer.
The contents of Footer appear at the bottom of the root designer on the workflow design surface.
Icons and text can be displayed in the footer, including button icons that change the designer view when a user selects one of them.

The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowHeaderFooter"></xref> that represents the footer associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref>.
Returns a read-only collection of points that represent the inner connection of the designer.
A designer can have connectors within it.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerEdges"></xref> on which to gather the collection of connection points.
A collection that contains the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConnectionPoint"></xref> objects used for a connectable designer.
Gets the collection of glyphs that are displayed on the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref>.

An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerGlyphCollection"></xref> that contains the glyphs displayed on the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref>.
Gets the header associated with the root designer.
The contents of Header appear at the top of the root designer on the workflow design surface.
Icons and text can be displayed in the header, including text that indicates the designer view that is currently displayed on the design surface.

The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowHeaderFooter"></xref> that represents the header associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref>.
Gets the image associated with the designer.
Image property is set to the <xref:System.Drawing.Image> to display.
You can do this at design time or at run time.
Unless overridden in a derived class, Image returns a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to associate with the designer.
Gets the value for the enclosing bounds of the image associated with the designer in logical coordinates.
Use the ImageRectangle to retrieve the coordinates for the rectangle that encloses the image associated with the designer.
You can use these coordinates for drawing connectors or overlaying graphics.

A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that encloses the <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> displayed for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> that requested the sequential workflow root designer to be initialized.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> that requested the workflow root designer to be initialized.
Gets the minimum size for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref>.
MinimumSize represents the smallest size to which a user can resize the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the minimum size of the sequential workflow designer.
Sets the size of the visual cues on the designers contained within the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs"></xref> that contains the layout arguments.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the size of the visual cues on the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref>.
Draws any headers and footers associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref>.
OnPaint draws any text to include in the headers and footers with the appropriate theme settings.
It also draws any images to include in the headers and footers.

**Note** When you override OnPaint in a derived class, be sure to call the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnPaint%2A> method of the base class so that registered delegates receive the event.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
e contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Notifies the designer whether smart tags are to be shown or hidden on the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref>.
When called, OnSmartTagVisibilityChanged invalidates the text rectangle associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.Header%2A>.

**Note** When you override OnSmartTagVisibilityChanged in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnSmartTagVisibilityChanged%2A> method so that registered delegates receive the event.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to display smart tags on the designer surface; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the root designer displays smart tags.

If the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.Header%2A> property is not set to a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) and the corresponding <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowHeaderFooter.Text%2A> property is not an empty string or set to a null reference (`Nothing`), ShowSmartTag returns `true`.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref> displays smart tags; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the rectangle on the designer surface in which to display a smart tag.

You can use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.ShowSmartTag%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.SmartTagVerbs%2A> to display a smart tag of available <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.DesignerActions%2A> at the location specified by SmartTagRectangle.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that defines the bounds in which to display the smart tag.
Gets the description associated with the designer.
Unless overridden in an inheriting class, Text returns <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.
A string that contains the description associated with the designer.
Gets the height of the title area of the designer.
A root designer title area typically contains the header and any icon associated with the designer.

TitleHeight calculates the integer it returns by getting the value of its base implementation and adding the height integer defined for the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner.Header%2A>.
An integer that represents the height of the title area of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref>.
